overview_of_class: Audiologic Counseling Core will address topics related to providing counseling to adults and children with impaired hearing and to their families and significant others. In a profession that is frequently dominated by its technical aspects, it is essential that audiologists enhance the patient-professional relationship by acquiring knowledge/skills related to counseling.
name: Clinical Study and Practicum in Audiology
title: SoC CSD 415-3-20 Clinical Study and Practicum in Audiology

descriptions.name: Overview of class
descriptions.value: Audiologic Counseling Core will address topics related to providing counseling to adults and children with impaired hearing and to their families and significant others. In a profession that is frequently dominated by its technical aspects, it is essential that audiologists enhance the patient-professional relationship by acquiring knowledge/skills related to counseling.

descriptions.name: Learning Objectives
descriptions.value:
By the end of the quarter, student will be able to:
1. Discuss current paradigms used to conceptualize counseling.
2. Apply various counseling paradigms to clinical audiology through case study presentation and analysis.
3. Identify aspects of clinical audiology that align with the perspectives and values of counseling, for the purpose of integrating counseling seamlessly and meaningfully into audiological practice.
4. Consider audiological diagnostic and treatment protocols from the perspective of their impact on the patient's sense of identity, self-efficacy, and capacity for relationship throughout the life-span.
5. Distinguish between audiologic counseling and counseling in other settings, identifying the distinctive features, challenges and resources of audiologic counseling.
6. Reflect on clinical situations from the perspective of best practices in audiological counseling.

descriptions.name: Class Materials (Required)
descriptions.value: Assigned Readings are from Clark, J. & English, K. (2004). Counseling in Audiologic Practice. Boston: Pearson.
